column2: On May 8, 1945, the Allies accepted German surrender terms at the conclusion of the European conflict of World War II. The Potsdam Conference (July 17 to August 2, 1945) attempted to confront the delicate balance of power of the opposing governmental structures, democracy and communism. However despite the agreement on the partitioning of Germany and the call for an unconditional surrender of Japan, the conference did nothing to quell the increasing tensions between the Western Allies and the Soviets. The destruction of Hiroshima and Nagasaki sealed the fate of Japan, and the surrender documents were signed on the USS Missouri on September 2nd, 1945. The attack on the Western Allies by the Soviets on October 2nd had been foreshadowed by Gen. Patton’s bellicose remarks and a series of border incidents. Now, the US faces another World War, while still weary from the last. Fortunately, in response to the Soviet threat, President Truman ordered B-29 bombers with A-Bombs to forward deploy to bases in Turkey, and he now has authorized an attack on the Soviet Union.Can the battle tested US Army hold back the Red tide? Will the US military’s large naval and air forces prove to be a decisive advantage? Can the US’s limited A-Bomb production capacity be the deciding factor in this final war?
column3: Le 8 Mai 1945, les Alliйs acceptиrent la capitulation allemande, ce qui termina la deuxiиme guerre mondiale en Europe. A la confйrence de Potsdam (17 Juillet jusqu'au 2 Aoыt 1945), on essaya d'arranger une balance de pouvoir entre les diffйrentes structures du gouvernement, dйmocratie et communisme. Malgr?les accords sur la partition de l’Allemagne et la demande d’une capitulation inconditionnelle du Japon, la confйrence ne parvint pas ?dйtendre les relations entre les Alliйs et les Soviйtiques. La destruction de Hiroshima et Nagasaki conclut le sort du Japon et les documents de capitulation йtaient signйs le 2 septembre au bord du USS Missouri. L'attaque de l’URSS ?l’Ouest avait йt?prйcйdйe par des remarques belliqueuses du Gйn. Patton et par plusieurs incidents de frontiиre. Maintenant les Йtats-Unis se retrouvent face ?une nouvelle guerre mondiale. Heureusement deux B-29 avec armes nuclйaires ont йt?stationnйs sur des bases en Turquie et Prйsident Truman vient d’autoriser une attaque contre l’Union Soviйtique. La capacit?de construire des armes nuclйaires sera-t-elle un avantage suffisant pour gagner la guerre?
column4: 8 Maggio 1945, gli alleati hanno accettato i termini tedeschi di resa alla conclusione del conflitto europeo della seconda guerra mondiale. Il congresso di Potsdam (17 luglio - 2 agosto 1945) ha tentato di confrontare il delicato equilibrio di forze delle opposte strutture di governo, democrazia e comunismo. Comunque malgrado l'accordo di dividere la Germania e la richiesta di una resa incondizionata del Giappone, la conferenza non ha fatto niente per allentare la crescente tensione fra gli alleati occidentali ed i sovietici. La distruzione di Hiroshima e di Nagasaki ha segnato il destino del Giappone ed i documenti di resa sono stati firmati sulla USS Missouri il 2 settembre 1945. L'attacco agli alleati occidentali dei Sovietici il 2 ottobre era stato preannunciato dalle osservazioni bellicose del Gen. Patton e da una serie di incidenti alla frontiera. Ora, gli Stati Uniti affrontano un'altra guerra mondiale, ancora provati dalla precedente. Fortunatamente, in risposta alla minaccia sovietica, il presidente Truman ha ordinato che bombardieri B-29 armati di ordigni nucleari si schierassero nelle basi in Turchia ed ora ha autorizzato un attacco all'Unione Sovietica. Potra' l'esercito degli Stati Uniti, forgiato in battaglia, trattenere la marea rossa? La grande Marina e Aeronautica degli Stati Uniti risulteranno essere un vantaggio decisivo? Potra' la limitata capacita' di produzione di bombe atomiche essere il fattore decisivo in questa guerra finale?
column5: El 8 de mayo de 1945, los Aliados aceptaron los tйrminos de la rendiciуn alemana en la conclusiуn de la II Guerra Mundial. La conferencia de Potsdam (del 17 de julio al 2 de agosto de 1945) intent?conciliar el delicado equilibrio de poder entre las estructuras de gobierno enfrentadas: la democracia y el comunismo. Sin embargo, a pesar del acuerdo en la particiуn de Alemania y la peticiуn de una rendiciуn incondicional de Japуn, la conferencia no pudo mitigar las crecientes tensiones entre los aliados occidentales y los soviйticos. Ahora, los EE. UU., todavнa fatigados por la anterior, se enfrentan a otra guerra mundial. August 1945) wurde versucht eine Machtbalance zwischen den Demokratien im Westen und dem Kommunismus im Osten zu finden. Trotz der Ьbereinkunft ьber die Aufteilung Deutschlands konnte die Konferenz die stдndig steigenden Spannungen zwischen den westlichen Alliierten und den Sowjets nicht mildern. Die Zerstцrung von Hiroshima und Nagasaki besiegelte das Schicksal Japans und die Kapitulation wurde am 2. September 1945 an Bord der USS Missouri unterzeichnet. Dem Angriff der Sowjets auf die westlichen Alliierten waren kriegerische Worte von Gen. Patton und kleinere Grenzgefechte vorausgegangen. Jetzt steht die immer noch kriegsmьde USA einem neuen Weltkrieg gegenьber. column2: On May 8, 1945, Germany surrendered, bringing to a close the Great Patriotic War. The Potsdam Conference (July 17 to August 2, 1945) attempted to confront the delicate balance of power of the opposing governmental structures, democracy and communism. However despite the agreement on the partitioning of Germany and the call for an unconditional surrender of Japan, the conference did nothing to quell the increasing tensions between the Western Allies and the Soviets. The Red Army’s attack on Manchuria sealed the fate of Japan, and the surrender documents were signed on the USS Missouri on September 2nd, 1945. Realizing the power of the Red Army vastly outweighed the American and British forces, and due in part to the provocative stationing of B-29 bombers with atomic weapons in Turkey, Stalin launched a bold bid to liberate Western Europe form the yoke of imperialism on October 2nd, 1945. Can the Red Army be victorious? Will the many communists in the West rise up to support the liberation? Will Stalin’s gambit to strike before the US can ramp up the production of A-Bombs prove correct?
column3: Le 8 Mai 1945, les Alliйs acceptиrent la capitulation allemande, ce qui termina la grande Guerre Patriotique. A la confйrence de Potsdam (17 Juillet jusqu'au 2 Aoыt 1945) on essaya d'arranger une balance de pouvoir entre les diffйrentes structures du gouvernement, dйmocratie et communisme. Malgr?les accords sur la partition de l’Allemagne et la demande d’une capitulation inconditionnelle du Japon, la confйrence ne parvint pas ?dйtendre les relations entre les Alliйs et les Soviйtiques. L’attaque de l’armйe rouge contre la Mandchourie conclut le sort du Japon et les documents de capitulation furent signйs le 2 septembre ?bord du USS Missouri. L’attaque ?l’Ouest avait йt?prйcйdйe par un stationnement provocateur d'armes nuclйaires en Turquie ce qui confirmait pour Staline la nйcessit?de libйrer l’Europe de l’impйrialisme amйricain. La tactique de Staline d’attaquer avant que les USA puissent augmenter leur capacit?de produire des armes nuclйaires sera-t-elle gagnante?
column4: 8 Maggio 1945, la Germania si e' arresa, concludendo la Grande Guerra Patriottica. Il congresso di Potsdam (17 luglio - 2 agosto 1945) ha tentato di confrontare il delicato equilibrio di forze delle opposte strutture di governo, democrazia e comunismo. Comunque malgrado l'accordo di dividere la Germania e la richiesta di una resa incondizionata del Giappone, la conferenza non ha fatto niente per allentare la crescente tensione fra gli alleati occidentali ed i sovietici. L'attacco dell'Armata Rossa in Manchuria ha segnato il destino del Giappone ed i documenti di resa sono stati firmati sulla USS Missouri il 2 settembre 1945. Realizzando che la potenza dell'Armata Rossa ha superato notevolmente le forze americane e britanniche e a causa della disposizione provocatoria dei bombardieri B-29 con armi atomiche in Turchia, Stalin ha iniziato un'offensiva, per liberare l'Europa occidentale dal giogo dell'imperialismo, il 2 ottobre 1945. Potra' l'Armata Rossa essere vittoriosa? I molti comunisti ad ovest sosterranno la liberazione? La mossa di Stalin di colpire prima che la produzione di bombe atomiche degli Stati Uniti dilaghi, si dimostrera' corretta?

column2: Churchill had feared that after V.E. Day on May 8, 1945, the Soviets could move westwards and threaten Britain. However, despite plans for “Operation Unthinkable'', a preemptive attack on the Soviet Union was discarded. Churchill, and then after his electoral defeat, Attlee attempted to confront the delicate balance of power of the opposing governmental structures, democracy and communism at the Potsdam Conference (July 17 to August 2, 1945). However, despite the agreement on the partitioning of Germany and the call for an unconditional surrender of Japan, the conference did nothing to quell the increasing tensions between the Western Allies and the Soviets. The destruction of Hiroshima and Nagasaki sealed the fate of Japan, and the surrender documents were signed on the USS Missouri on September 2nd, 1945. The attack on the Western Allies by the Soviets on October 2nd had been foreshadowed by Churchill's fears and a series of border incidents. Now, the UK faces another terrible war. Will the rest of the Commonwealth once again stand by the UK? Will Churchill once again come to center stage? Will the Western Allies hold, or will Britain once again face an occupied Europe across the Channel?

column2: On May 8, 1945, the Allies accepted German surrender terms at the conclusion of the European conflict of World War II. The destruction of Hiroshima and Nagasaki sealed the fate of Japan, and the surrender documents were signed on the USS Missouri on September 2nd, 1945. Of a population just over eleven million, more than one and a half million Canadians served in the Second World War. By the end of World War II, Canada was the fourth strongest military power in the world, behind only the USA, the USSR, and the UK. This Herculean effort created political strain in Canada. Now with a new war underway, Canada must again rise to the challenge. Will conscription come to the forefront as a political issue again? What role will Canada play in a Eurasian land war?

column2: As the Allies and Soviets closed in on Germany in the summer of 1944, the liberation of Poland fell to the Soviets. The Polish Home Army rose up against Germany in Warsaw as the Red Army advanced. However, Stalin halted the advance and allowed Germany to crush the Polish resistance in two long months of bitter house-to-house combat. In January 1945 the Lublin Committee became a provisional government and was recognized by the Soviet Union. The Red Army expelled the last German troops from Poland in March 1945, several weeks before the final victory in Europe. At Potsdam Conference (July 17 to August 2, 1945), Poland’s borders were redrawn displacing millions of Poles and Germans. Now Stalin has launched the liberation of the rest of Europe. Can the unpopular communist government maintain control over the populace? What role will Poland play in this crusade against capitalism?
column3: Face ?l’avance de l’armйe rouge vers Varsovie, la rйsistance polonaise se levait pour contribuer ?sa libйration. En Mars 1945 l’armйe rouge expulsait les derniers Allemands de la Pologne, et lors de la confйrence de Potsdam, les frontiиres de la Pologne йtaient redessinйes, dйplaзant des millions d'Allemands et de Polonais. Alla Conferenza di Potsdam (17 luglio - 2 agosto 1945), i confini della Polonia furono ridisegnati e spostarono milioni di Polacchi e Tedeschi. Ora Stalin ha iniziato la liberazione del resto d'Europa. L'impopolare governo comunista pu?mantenere il controllo sulla popolazione? Che ruolo avra' la Polonia questa crociata contro il capitalismo?

column2: Following the collapse of the Ottoman Empire after World War I, the League of Nations mandated the five provinces that make up Lebanon to France. After the Vichy government assumed power in France in 1940, the Vichy government controlled Lebanon. The Vichy government's control ended when its forces were unable to halt the advance of British and Free French troops into Lebanon and Syria. As a result of national and international pressure, on November 26, 1941, France proclaimed the independence of Lebanon. The United States, Britain, the Soviet Union and other governments recognized Lebanon’s independence. However, even though the French technically recognized Lebanon's independence, the French authorities maintained control and linked the Lebanese currency to the depreciating French franc, tying the Lebanese economy to that of France. When will Lebanon truly be free?

Quando sar?veramente libero il Libano?

column2: Following the collapse of the Ottoman Empire after World War I an independent Arab Kingdom of Syria was established under King Faysal. However, his rule over Syria ended in July 1920 when French forces entered Syria to impose their League of Nations mandate. After the Vichy government assumed power in France in 1940, the Vichy government controlled Syria. The Vichy government's control ended when its forces were unable to halt the advance of British and Free French troops into Lebanon and Syria. The entry of Allied troops brought a promise from the Free French leader, General Charles de Gaulle, of eventual independence. During 1944 the Syrian government took over some of the internal governmental functions. The United States and the Soviet Union and other governments recognized Syria’s independence. The Allied nations pressured France to evacuate Syria to no avail. When will Syria truly be free?

column2: In February 1943, the Red Army turned the tide with a counteroffensive at Stalingrad, and the German and Romanian armies began their retreat westward. Allied bombardment slowed Romania's industries as the Red Army advanced toward Romania. On August 23 ,1944, a coup led by King Michael, with support from opposition politicians and the army, deposed the Antonescu dictatorship and put Romania's armies under Red Army command. The coup speeded the Red Army's advance, and the Soviet Union later awarded Michael the Order of Victory for overthrowing Antonescu and bringing Romania into the war against the Axis. On September 12th, Romania and the Soviet Union signed an armistice on terms Stalin dictated. In late February 1945, Red Army troops staged a coup and placed communists in charge of the government and the king fled to the British mission. The communist party, backed by the power of the Red Army, is now in control. What role will Romania play in the war between Communism and Capitalism?
column3: En fйvrier 1943 l’armйe rouge commenзait avec sa contre-offensive et les Allemands et Roumains commenзaient leur retraite vers l’ouest. column4: Nel febbraio 1943, l'Armata Rossa respinse la marea con una controffensiva a Stalingrado, e gli eserciti tedeschi e rumeni cominciarono la loro ritirata verso ovest. Il colpo di stato velocizzo' l'avanzata russa e l'Unione Sovietica diede in un secondo tempo l'Ordine della Vittoria a Re Michele per aver rovesciato Antonescu e per aver condotto la Romania nella guerra contro l'Asse. Il 12 Settembre la Romania e l'Unione Sovietica firmarono un armistizio su termini dettati da Stalin. Nel tardo febbraio del 1945, truppe dell'Armata Rossa inscenarono un colpo di stato e misero i comunisti a capo del governo. Il re fuggi' presso gli Inglesi. Il partito comunista, appoggiato dalla potenza dell'Armata Rossa ora ?al potere. Che ruolo avra' la Romania nella guerra tra Comunismo e Capitalismo?

column2: When the Red Army reached Bulgaria, they were welcomed by the populace as liberators from German occupation. column2: After the invasion of 1941, Germany created the puppet state of Croatia. Germany, Italy, Hungary, and Bulgaria dismembered the remainder of Yugoslavia. However, a number of partisan organizations soon arose. The communist Partisans led by the Partisan leader, Josip Broz Tito became the major force in the resistance against the Axis. When the Red Army reached the Yugoslav border in September 1944, Tito travelled secretly to Moscow, arranged for the Red Army to enter Yugoslavia, and secured Stalin's word that it would leave the country once it was secure, without interfering with domestic politics. Now, the communists under Tito have emerged from the war as sole rulers of Yugoslavia. And while Yugoslavia has avoided indirect Soviet rule, Stalin has refused to remove Red Army troops and is using Yugoslavia as a jumping off point for the invasion of Italy. What fate awaits Yugoslavia?
column3: Aprиs l’invasion de 1941, l’Allemagne crйa la Croatie tandis que l’Allemagne, l’Italie, la Bulgarie et la Hongrie se partagиrent le reste de la Yougoslavie. column2: Initial resistance to the German and Italian occupation of Greece was mild and sporadic. Communist partisans organized the first serious resistance, the EAM, in 1941, and its military wing, the ELAS, in 1942. Many non-communists were attracted to the front. The British, worried about communist control of the resistance, formed its own, known as the EDES. When the tide of war turned against the fascists, the Greek communists missed a golden opportunity to grab power. After the war, a coalition was attempted between the Communist and Royalist forces, but the coalition eventually broke down. The Democratic Army of Greece controls many of the rural areas, especially in the north. In the unlikely event of the communist side's victory in the Greek Civil War, KKE-ELAS will convert to Greece with a communist government.

Greece is a deeply divided country. The Greek government supported by the USA and the UK, has been effectively been embroiled in a civil war with the communist partisan army, ELAS. Now Stalin has attacked the West and it seems only a matter of time before the Red Army advances on Greece. Will the USA and the UK provide troops to defend Greece?

column2: In 1952, Fulgencio Batista seized control of the Cuban government. Opposition was from both constitutionalist democrats and a young Communist leader named Fidel Castro, born out of wedlock along with his brother Raul. On July 26, 1953, Fidel Castro led an attack on the Moncada Barracks in Santiago de Cuba. The attack failed and scores of the participants were killed. Fidel was arrested, along with his brother Raul, tried and sentenced to 15 years in prison. Two years later, in 1955, they were freed, thanks in part to the support of the Jesuits, of whom Castro was a member. The Castro brothers escaped to Mexico and found as allies a young Argentinian doctor-turned revolutionary named Che Guevara, and Spanish Civil War veteran General Alberto Bayo y Giraud, who was living in exile in Mexico. They returned from Mexico on December 2, 1956, and began staging raids on small outposts. Though the rebel army was small, numbering only a few hundred men and women, the Cuban Army responded ineffectively, and lost nearly every battle, despite massive numerical superiority. Will Batista finally launch an effective response to destroy the group? Or would Batista give way to the constitutionalists and completely destroy the movement's support amongst the educated classes?

column2: Between 1941 and 1944, communist partisans and nationalist guerrillas fought Italian and German occupation forces, and more often each other, in a brutal struggle to take control of Albania. Backed by Yugoslavia's communists and armed with British and United States weaponry, Albania's partisans defeated the nationalists in a civil war fought between Italy's capitulation in September 1943 and the withdrawal of German forces from Albania in late 1944. By early 1945, the communists had consolidated their power with the backing of the Red Army. Now Albania is subservient to both Yugoslavia and the Soviet Union. What role will Albania play in the titanic struggle between east and west?
column3: Entre 1941 et 1944, des partisans communistes et nationalistes se battirent contre les occupants autant qu' entre eux-mкmes. column4: Tra il 1941 ed il 1944, partigiani comunisti e guerriglia nazionalista lottarono contro l'occupazione tedesca e italiana, e pi?spesso l'un l'altro, in una lotta brutale per prendere il controllo dell'Albania. Appoggiati dai comunisti yugoslavi e riforniti di armi dagli inglesi e americani, i partigiani albanesi sconfissero i nazionalisti in una guerra civile combattuta tra la capitolazione dell'Italia nel settembre 1943 ed il ritiro delle forze tedesche dall'Albania nel tardo 1944. Agli inizi del 1945, i comunisti avevano consolidato il loro potere col sostegno dell'Armata Rossa. Ora l'Albania ?subordinata sia alla Yugoslavia che all'Unione Sovietica. Che ruolo avra' nella lotta titanica fra est e ovest?

column2: During World War II, Czechoslovakia disappeared from the map of Europe. However, in London Czechoslovak exiles organized a government-in-exile and negotiated to obtain international recognition for the government and a renunciation of the Munich Agreement and its consequences. As Germany collapsed, the liberation of Czechoslovakia fell to the Red Army. The popular enthusiasm evoked by the Soviet armies of liberation benefited the Communist Party of Czechoslovakia. Czechoslovaks, bitterly disappointed by the West at Munich, responded favorably to both the communists and to a Soviet alliance. Stalin established a communist state subservient to Moscow, heightening tensions with the Western Allies in the summer of 1945. Now, Stalin has launched the liberation of Western Europe and the Red Army is striking from jumping off points in Czechoslovakia into occupied Germany. What fate awaits Czechoslovakia?

Che desitino attende la Cecoslovacchia?

column6: Wдhrend des Zweiten Weltkrieges war Tschechien von der Karte verschwunden. Jedoch organisierte sich in London eine Exilregierung, die sich internationale Anerkennung und die Rьckweisung des Mьnchner Abkommens sichern konnte. column2: As tensions in Europe heightened, Turkey kept neutral. The Molotov-Ribbentrop Pact of August 1939 prompted Turkey to sign a treaty of mutual assistance with Britain and France in October. Hedging its bets, the government concluded a nonaggression treaty with Nazi Germany on June 18, 1941, just four days before the Axis invasion of the Soviet Union. The early military successes of the Axis forces contributed to increased pro-German sentiment, even in some official circles. Despite German pressure, Turkey at no time permitted the passage of Axis troops, ships, or aircraft through or over Turkey and its waters, and the Montreux Convention was scrupulously enforced in the straits. Turkey broke diplomatic relations with Germany in August 1944, and, on February 23, 1945, declared war on Germany. Now Turkey is truly at war. Will the Allies reinforce Turkey? Can the Red Army be stopped?
column3: Alors que les tensions en Europe grandissaient, la Turquie resta neutre. Le pacte Molotov-Ribbentrop d’Aoыt 1939 poussa la Turquie ?signer un trait?d’assistance mutuelle avec la Grande Bretagne et la France en Octobre. Agissant sur le fil du rasoir, le gouvernement conclut un trait?de non-agression avec l’Allemagne Nazie le 18 Juin 18 1941, juste quatre jours avant l’invasion de l’Union Soviйtique par l’Axe. Les succиs militaires initiaux des forces de l’axe contribuиrent ?accroоtre le sentiment pro-Allemand, mкme dans certains cercles officiels. Malgr?la pression Allemande, la Turquie ne permit jamais ?l’axe le passage de troupes, de navires, ou d’avions ?travers ou au dessus de la Turquie et de ses eaux, et la convention de Montreux fut scrupuleusement appliquйe dans les dйtroits. column4: All'aumentare della tensione in Europa, la Turchia si mantenne neutrale. Il Patto di Molotov-Ribbentrop nell'agosto 1939, costrinse la Turchia a firmare un trattato di mutua assistenza con Inghilterra e Francia in ottobre. Il governo inoltre concluse un trattato di non aggressione con la Germania Nazista il 18 giugno 1941, solo quattro giorni prima dell'invasione dell'Unione Sovietica. I primi successi militari dell'Asse contribuirono ad aumentare i sentimenti pro-tedeschi, perfino in alcuni circoli ufficiali. Nonostante la pressione tedesca, la Turchia non permise il passaggio di truppe, navi o aerei dell'Asse attraverso la Turchia e le sue acque, e la Convenzione di Montreux fu osservata scrupolosamente negli stretti. La Turchia ruppe le relazioni diplomatiche con la Germania nell'agosto 1944, e il 23 febbraio 1945, dichiaro' guerra alla Germania. Ora la Turchia ?realmente in guerra. Gli Alleati la rinforzeranno? L'Armata Rossa pu?essere fermata?

column2: Iceland was settled by Norwegian Vikings over the period of 870-830. After a period of independence, the Norwegian king forced Iceland into a monarchical union in the early 1260s. In 1397, Norway lost its independence to Denmark. The 18th century was truly a devastating century for Iceland, three times the population fell below 40,000 due to famine, small-pox and natural disasters. In 1904 Iceland gained home-rule. After the fall of Denmark, Great Britain sent a military force to defend the island from possible German attack, and this was replaced in July 1941 by U.S. forces under a U.S.-Icelandic defence agreement. The large number of British and American troops had given a boost to the economy, increasing calls for independence. The Icelandic Republic was established on June 17, 1944, after a national referendum where 97 percent of the population voted for a split with the Danish crown. Now, the small Icelandic Coast Guard is the only defense force, and Iceland relies on the USA for defense. What path forward should Iceland take?

column4: L'Islanda venne abitata da vichinghi norvegesi negli anni 830-870. Dopo un periodo di indipendenza, il re norvegese costrinse l'Islanda in un'unione monarchica nel 1262. column2: During the Second World War, Denmark was occupied by Germany. Forced by circumstances during the German ‘peaceful occupation? King Christian X and the Danish government led by the Social Democrat Thorvald Stauning chose to collaborate with the occupying power. In this way, government hoped to create the easiest conditions for the population. In 1943, Germany intensified its demands on the collaboration. From 1943, the increasing popular resistance to the Germans created the basis for an underground movement. Now, war rages across Europe yet again. Will the Allies be able to stop the Red Army, or will Denmark face the specter of occupation once again?

column2: In January 1943, the Red Army turned the tide with a counteroffensive at Stalingrad and destroyed Hungary's Second Army in February. Hungary subsequently withdrew the remainder of its army to inside its own borders in April 1943. In September 1944, the Red Army crossed the border, and on October 15 Hungary had signed an armistice with the Soviet Union. However, the Germans staged a coup and installed a pro Axis government. Germany held off the Soviet troops until April 4, 1945, when the last German troops were driven out of Hungary. In the aftermath of World War II, Stalin succeeded in forcing its political, social, and economic system on Hungary despite a previously negotiated influence scheme with Britain, further exasperating tensions between east and west. Now, Stalin has launched the Red Army against the Allies. What fate awaits Hungary in this titanic struggle?

column6: Im Januar 1943 wandte sich das Kriegsglьck in Stalingrad und die ungarische zweite Armee wurde zerstцrt. April 1945 behaupten konnte. In den Nachwehen des Zweiten Weltkriegs konnte Stalin Ungarn sein eigenes politisches, soziales und wirtschaftliches System aufzwingen, obwohl zuerst mit den Briten ein Kompromiss ausgehandelt worden war. column2: The Sultanate of Brunei's influence peaked between the 15th and 17th centuries when its control extended over coastal areas of northwest Borneo and the southern Philippines. Brunei subsequently entered a period of decline brought on by internal strife over royal succession, colonial expansion of European powers, and piracy. In 1888, Brunei became a British protectorate.

column2: In 1940, Germany invaded Belgium and Holland. As the blitzkrieg swept across the country, the Belgian government evacuated to London. King Leopold III, however, surrendered to the German forces when the Belgian lines were broken and Belgium was occupied. His action incurred the violent disapproval of the Belgian people and brought accusations of treason. Leopold III was held prisoner in the palace of Laeken before being taken to Germany. During the war, the largest known reserves of uranium were in the Belgian Congo. The Belgian company Union Miniиre du Haut Katanga provided the United States the uranium required by the Manhattan Project. When the British, Canadian, and American armies liberated Belgium at the end of 1944, popular feeling against Leopold III was substantial, and his brother Prince Karel assumed regency. Now, war once again rages across Europe. Will the Allied armies hold? Or will Belgium face occupation yet again?

column2: Following the collapse of the Ottoman Empire after World War I, the League of Nations mandated the five provinces that make up Lebanon to France. After the Vichy government assumed power in France in 1940, the Vichy government controlled Lebanon. The Vichy government's control ended when its forces were unable to halt the advance of British and Free French troops into Lebanon and Syria. As a result of national and international pressure, on November 26, 1941, France proclaimed the independence of Lebanon. The United States, Britain, the Soviet Union and other governments recognized Lebanon’s independence. However, even though the French technically recognized Lebanon's independence, the French authorities maintained control and linked the Lebanese currency to the depreciating French franc, tying the Lebanese economy to that of France. When will Lebanon truly be free?
column3: Suite ?l'effondrement de l’Empire Ottoman aprиs la premiиre guerre mondiale, la ligue de Nations mandatait le Liban sous contrфle de la France. column2: Following the collapse of the Ottoman Empire after World War I an independent Arab Kingdom of Syria was established under King Faysal. However, his rule over Syria ended in July 1920 when French forces entered Syria to impose their League of Nations mandate. After the Vichy government assumed power in France in 1940, the Vichy government controlled Syria. The Vichy government's control ended when its forces were unable to halt the advance of British and Free French troops into Lebanon and Syria. The entry of Allied troops brought a promise from the Free French leader, General Charles de Gaulle, of eventual independence. During 1944 the Syrian government took over some of the internal governmental functions. The United States and the Soviet Union and other governments recognized Syria’s independence. The Allied nations pressured France to evacuate Syria to no avail. When will Syria truly be free?
column3: Suite ?l'effondrement de l’Empire Ottoman aprиs la premiиre guerre mondiale, la Syrie devenait un royaume indйpendant sous Faysal I. All'entrata delle truppe Alleate segui' una promessa del leader francese, il Generale Charles de Gaulle, di un'eventuale indipendenza. Durante il 1944 il governo Siriano assunse alcune delle funzioni governative ed interne. Gli Stati Uniti e l'Unione sovietica e gli altri governi riconobbero l'indipendenza della Siria.
